page.title: 05People of our times
page.content: There are lots of different people who live in Croxteth. My Mum and Dad have no jobs so my Dad sits and reads his paper and my Mum does the housework. There are some people who work, and there are people looking for jobs. In Croxteth there are many people on the dole, and there are people who work. There are the doctors, postmen, policemen, caretakers, teachers, and lots more. There is the bus-driver who takes people to Liverpool and then back to Croxteth. Some taxis just stay around Croxteth to take people to Broadway and to town. In Croxteth there are woods, and Croxteth Country Park. They have built a new Sports Centre, but it isn't open yet. They have knocked a lot of the flats down to make bungalows. Karen Deaves
